application_type_full: Tree works: Trees in conservation areas/subject to TPOs
decision_conditions: The ash tree is situated in the front garden of 9 Willow End, Northwood. It is a mature tree that, whilst showing evidence of historic branch shedding, is dominant within the landscape, and appears in fair condition. It can be viewed by properties on Willow Grove and Woodgate Crescent. For these reasons, it is considered to have a moderate to high amenity value. The crown of the tree has responded well to previous work, and the branches, stem and base appeared free from decay fungi.

Work to fell the ash tree has been proposed on the basis that there is hollowing and decay through tree from base to crown. This claim has not been substantiated with any evidence, and upon inspection by an Officer, the stem at the base to approximately midway appeared intact, and free of cavities. Photographic images were provided with the application, but appeared to show a moderate sized cavity, and not hollowing from the base as described. The pictures showed a cavity close up with no scale or referenc
The removal of deadwood, dangerous / hanging branches and ivy:  This does not require the formal consent of the Council.
description: To fell One Ash at T4 within TPO 433A
